page.title: 06Farming, Isle of Skye
page.content: Sheep form an important part of the economy of the crofters. Various breeds are kept, such as Cheviot, Suffolk, Blackface and a few Jacobs. The lambs are taken to market in September and October. Some crofters send their sheep to the mainland for wintering,although most are wintered here. Some older animals are slaughtered for home consumption. A few families keep cows,mainly to have a supply of milk for their own use. One or two households keep goats;also for milk. Land is cultivated on a small scale to enable crops like hay, corn and potatoes to be grown. Several people own fishing boats. They fish locally for herring, mackerel and haddock, when in season. Some also fish for lobsters and crabs.
